data.text:
@theblogmire Most of them go back to 'pcr tests don't tell us there is an issue'.  That's the core of a lot of his claims here.

Yeah...there's an issue.  Or is India having issues with all their dead bodies from an entirely unrelated and unknown event?

@theblogmire I'm most of the way through this and I've seen nothing about the spike proteins staying in blood cells.  I'm going to be very put out if that's not actually in there.  Insofar, his claims don't hold water.

(1/2)

@theblogmire Autopsies - have been done on covid patients.

no one is disputing that a very small percentage have died from blood clots.  That has nothing to do with overall efficacy.

@theblogmire a majority of the time.  And if it wasn't able to detect covid - we wouldn't see -any- change of pcr test positivity in areas exhibiting high incidences of covid symptoms.

BS.  Bud.  Sorry.

@theblogmire 4.) Argument on spike proteins causing damage on the vessel linings.  Sure.  But if that were going to happen it would happen very quickly after innoculation.  If it's not life threatening, it's not a problem.

And it is in only an extremely few cases.

@theblogmire Re Bhakdi video: 

1.) Bad argument on covid-19 death numbers.  It's not just a pcr test that indicates a covid death.  Doctors seeing the patients definitely are required to determine cause of death.

2.) No argument on anti mask lockdown etc.  So... 
(1/?)

@theblogmire Sure.  Why not watch hour long videos on every scientist espousing a new theory that goes against the conclusions the rest of the world has come to.

I'll check it out in written form somewhere.

@mauveTriforce Absolutely not. The mRNA does not last long in the body, but the spike proteins stay in the blood cells and cannot escape. You really should watch Professor Sucharit Bhakdi explain all this before concluding that "we'd know by now".

https://t.co/LkYCh9drok

@mauveTriforce No. Because what you need to understand is that these mRNA packages enter cells throughout the entire body, including blood cells, which coronaviruses do not normally enter. That makes them potentially very dangerous.
@theblogmire Yes.  You're correct.
@theblogmire I see.  I missed that specification in the wording of your original point.  My mistake.
@mauveTriforce I'm pretty sure rabies is not the same thing as a coronavirus.
@theblogmire https://t.co/guCrsYOuYf
@mauveTriforce No. I'm referring to the word "coronavirus".
@theblogmire Are you referring to when I said 'used before, just not in a public capacity'?
@mauveTriforce So when are you going to give me evidence of mRNA coronavirus vaccines being used before?

@theblogmire COVID-19 was available, scientists began designing the mRNA instructions for cells to build the unique spike protein into an mRNA vaccine.

https://t.co/Tke7e71JpD
@theblogmire mRNA vaccines have been studied before for flu, Zika, rabies, and cytomegalovirus (CMV). As soon as the necessary information about the virus that causes (3/4)

@theblogmire vaccines because they can be developed in a laboratory using readily available materials. This means the process can be standardized and scaled up, making vaccine development faster than traditional methods of making vaccines.
(2/?)

@theblogmire Why yes, I would be happy to.

From the cdc website

mRNA Vaccines Are New, But Not Unknown
Researchers have been studying and working with mRNA vaccines for decades. Interest has grown in these (1/?)
@mauveTriforce No. mRNA coronavirus vaccines have not been used before. You're welcome to show me the documented evidence of them having been used before though, if you can find it.

@theblogmire That's false.  mRNA vaccines have been used before.  Just no in a public capacity.

Experimental - doesn't see, to be an agreed upon descriptor.  Looking into it.

@mauveTriforce Of course it’s experimental. A coronavirus vaccine using mRNA technology has never been used before, and they have not completed the clinical trials, which are due to finish in 2023 (thus the mid-long term effects CANNOT yet be known).

@theblogmire A.) It's not experimental.

B.) Yes.  The reason is to stop the spread of the disease.
Children are estimated to be 60% as effective in spreading covid.  More than enough to keep the pandemic going.

https://t.co/VC4C87GEuR

@theblogmire @juniordoctorldn There’s one thing absolutely guaranteed. More children and young adults will die from the vax in the rollout than from Covid.  In the long term that will be massively enhanced.
@theblogmire @juniordoctorldn I believe two teenagers on that study have died aged 15 and 16.
@theblogmire Watch Children of Men
@theblogmire @surveyorX depopulation.
@Aslan_Not_Tame @theblogmire many parents don't understand that their children are less at risk from catching covid than the flu!
@theblogmire And the article link looks like a poster for a sinister & wicked movie.

@theblogmire @tessyursine When will people grasp that dying isn’t the only danger. Regardless of age you can have permanent damage to major organs, brain included and never recover! If you’re fat, diabetic, drink or smoke or a BAME, the risk is greater.
@theblogmire 'could be approved' give be a break u sick f'kers
@theblogmire Sterilisation, pacification technology, microchips, social conditioning (psychological warfare), genocide... can't think of any benign or benevolent reasons...
@theblogmire How are they going to rollout vaccine passports if the children are unvaccinated?

@theblogmire For decades Big Pharma have been pumping kids with an increasing number of vaccines which are all but mandated in some jurisdictions & which have never been subjected to RCTs & for which they are indemnified against damages claims. Follow the money. And the Great Reset.
@theblogmire There is none.  Non existent argument.  But hey, we live on an age when a man can say he's a woman, or vice versa, and it can't be questioned

@theblogmire @InProportion2 Any parent that considers, even for a moment, subjecting their otherwise healthy child to an injection with an experimental gene therapy, still in its phase 3 clinical trials, is, quite frankly, insane & in dereliction of their duty to protect their child now & for their future.
@theblogmire @InProportion2 I know...
@theblogmire @InProportion2 https://t.co/nT99pd7GG7
@theblogmire @InProportion2 https://t.co/wSpBuDAbMp
@theblogmire https://t.co/nPKwd4FGOm
@theblogmire Please, parents everywhere, your children are not at risk from Covid. But the vaccine? Who knows; do you? Why would you risk it?
@theblogmire These people are no different to a Jimmy Saville or a Michael Jackson. They will harm innocent children for their own gratification. Our repulsion and anger at them should be as strong.
@theblogmire NO!! No, god, no - no jabs for kids. No coerced or forced jabs for anyone #NoVaccinePassports #NoVaccinePassports
@theblogmire Very sinister!
